news.headline: Figuring Out If A Doctor Is In Your Network Can Be Perplexing
news.subhead: Some physicians can be in-network when working at one office but not when they are at another. Or they may belong to a medical group that is affiliated with your plan, but they don't participate.

news.headline: Satisfied Patients Now Make Hospitals Richer, But Is That Fair?
news.subhead: The Affordable Care Act made sure that hospitals scoring well on patient satisfaction surveys are paid more by Medicare. But some say that gives small, boutique hospitals an unfair edge.

news.headline: California Health Exchange Considers Extending Enrollment For Some
news.subhead: Plenty of uninsured people will discover they owe a penalty as they file their taxes over the next two months, and will also learn they could be locked out of buying insurance to solve the problem.
